executive_summary: Primary care doctors play a vital role in preventive medicine, reducing healthcare costs and providing comprehensive care across all age groups. However, primary care doctors and the healthcare industry in the United States are navigating a complex landscape influenced by shifting demographics, economic factors, technological advancements and the enduring fallout of COVID-19. Despite a growing need for primary care doctor services propelled by an aging population, there is a noticeable dip in interest from younger adults opting for alternative healthcare alternatives like telemedicine, outpatient facilities and urgent care centers. The scarcity of primary care physicians, particularly in geriatric care specialties, presents concerns related to burnout, reduced access to care and the need to recruit medical students to address the escalating healthcare needs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demographic Shifts on Balance Spurs Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The growth of the US population, accompanied by the rising number of older US citizens in the 65 and older demographic, boosted demand for industry services. Adults 65 and older's share of total health spending is nearly twice the size of the population. So, any increase in the number of individuals has an essential impact on revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Declines in the population under five years and 18 years of age
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Declines in the population under five years and 18 years of age have led to a smaller pool of patients for pediatric primary care doctors.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Millennials are less likely to seek out primary care doctors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While the industry has benefited from a growing elderly population, demand from young adults has declined.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: FEWER MEDICAL STUDENTS AND AN AGING POPULATION CREATE A PHYSICIAN SHORTAGE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: For over a decade, the US has not been able to grow its healthcare sector enough to keep up with the aging population.
The pandemic was responsible for a moderate drop in industry revenue in 2020 before recovering in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The increasing size of the older adult population will likely boost demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US National Center for Health Statistics suggests that US demographics will drive the use of physician services at a more rapid pace.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Physician shortage shows no signs of stopping
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As long as the older adult population grows faster than the total population, the healthcare sector will unlikely expand fast enough to meet the new demand for physicians.
Operators in the industry will benefit from technological innovation and the digitization of healthcare services.

industry_definition: This industry includes general practitioners with a Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Doctor of Osteopathy (DO) degree. These doctors primarily work with a broad understanding of all illnesses and do not restrict their practice to one particular field of medicine.

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid

key_trends: More patients are choosing telehealth services.
Alternative healthcare provides an alternative to primary care.

market_segmentation.segment: Children and Adolescents Under 18 Provide a Consistent
market_segmentation.segment_description: Many schools mandate that students have a pediatrician for routine care and vaccinations.
The majority of payments come from individuals in this age group.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Family Medicine and General Practice Doctors

products_and_services.product_description: Pediatric care provides consistent revenue through annual care.

Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Internal Medicine Physicians Focus on Adult Care
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Internists are doctors who focus on general medical care.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: General Practice Doctors Provide Care for the Whole Family
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While similar to internists, general care doctors care for adults and children.

business_locations.location_description: More than one-quarter of the US population resides in the Southeast region.
According to BLS data, California has the most primary care practices in the US.

regulations_points.regulation_title: HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT (HIPPA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: HIPAA sets national standards to protect patient privacy.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Complex educational and regulatory requirements create steep financial and legal barriers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Inflation Pressures Primary Care Practices to Reevaluate Purchases
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: What primary care providers spend on supplies has only changed marginally.

FAQs.question: How do you plan to effectively market your primary care services to attract new patients in the local community?
FAQs.answer: Primary care providers need to develop a targeted marketing strategy to stand out.
